title: (x) New York Magazine condensed headline face - Elderkin {Yves}
content:
Hey all,

Any idea what's that awesome font used in the New York magazine headlines? Its so bold and rounded, it almost looks treated.

(on top)  
 [http://www.rogerblack.com/global/img/posts/conversation\_with\_hayman/nyma...](http://web.archive.org/web/20100304071709/http:/www.rogerblack.com/global/img/posts/conversation_with_hayman/nymagazinecover.jpg "http://www.rogerblack.com/global/img/posts/conversation\_with\_hayman/nymagazinecover.jpg")

Thanks,  
Misha
author: mishamazor

comments.content: If you know what you're looking for, it's always better to first do a Search. This is [Eric Olson](http://web.archive.org/web/20100304071709/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Eric%2520Olson)'s retired Elderkin, as can be read [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100304071709/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12397), [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100304071709/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12398) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100304071709/http:/typophile.com/node/33204).
You could also look at Brauer Neue, from [www.lineto.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100304071709/http:/www.lineto.com/ "www.lineto.com")
